Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that there have been "no new jobs" since the GOP took control of the House, which is contradicted by the fact that over a million jobs have been added in the last year.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not acknowledging the job growth that has occurred in the past year.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks support as it fails to provide evidence or data to support the assertion that there have been no new jobs.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the lack of new jobs is solely the responsibility of the GOP, without considering other factors that contribute to job creation.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for job growth or lack thereof.
